body: Don't we already have contributing guidelines in `CONTRIBUTING.md`? Looks like @lostanlen closed that PR. What happened?

Yes, I began last week with a stub of `CONTRIBUTING.md` (#172 ) which was adapted from scikit-learn but then I got confused with git branches so I closed the PR. We need to start afresh, possibly with some of the things I made in #172

issue.title: ENH README.md: install from source + install from pip

repository.name: kymatio
repository.description: Wavelet scattering transforms in Python with GPU acceleration

issue.body:
Hi,

I think we should add two manners to install the software in the README(similarly to pytorch)

1. Via the sources.(this is currently not proposed)
2. Via "pip"

Let me know your thoughts about it!

Edouard

body:
@edouardoyallon bullet point 3 is by far the hardest. see your issue #224 which is basically my point 3.

I once wrote a PR for this #172 but eventually closed it because I was on the wrong track. But there might be some parts worth salvaging from that PR.
The contributing guidelines of sklearn and librosa are an excellent model in my opinion.

NB: it would also be good to ask devs to run the troubleshooting script of PyTorch. see the link to that PR in #172

repository.name: kymatio
repository.description: Wavelet scattering transforms in Python with GPU acceleration
